page.title: 09Farming near West Haddon
page.content: This page is based on an interview with a local farmer living at a farm called Silsworth Lodge.The farmer runs two farms, both of which are about 300 years old. There are 310 acres altogether. The farmer owns all the land. On this land he has got some breeding ewes, two horses, some bantams and cows.He has got lots of machinery, four tractors and a combine harvester.The crops that are grown are winter wheat, winter barley, winter oats, and oil seed rape plus grass. The farm supplies milling grain for human consuption, lamb and beef,plus some eggs for the house.The crops are dried and cleaned if necessary when they are harvested. They are then sold to the open market. The straw is usually burned.
